source.3223f1d3:
# A/B Testing with Python on the Lalonde dataset *Autor: Yuanyuan Mao* 1. [Dataset overview](#overview)
1. [Conclusion](#conc)
source.c005be26: ## 2 Conclusion One can see directly that the dataset is not balanced. The difference between the treated group and the control group is big in every dimension. **It is thus not feasible to conduct a reasonable A/B test of the hypothesis that treatment can increase the income using this dataset.**
source.9a371847: **From the comparison we can see that the control group has higher income than the treated group.** This is of course very counter-intuitive. Let's dig in the details of the both groups.
source.a0a0e6e1: **First we show the raw difference between the treated group and the control group in the year *1974*, *1975* and *1978*, respectively.**
source.95a7e358: ## The goal of the this project is to see whether the income of the treated group increased faster than the income of the control group.
